tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In other words, they doubted that by rejecting Muhammad, they would face degradation and humiliation in the world of the Hereafter. But they did not believe in a Hereafter of such a nature as is mentioned in the Quran
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse primarily teach us?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The physical events of the present world are indicative of the nature of the Hereafter. The ‘present’ of our world implies that it should have a ‘future’ consistent with it
distractors: This verse describes the creation of mankind
This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Whatever seemed delightful in the world will become a horrible torture for him in the Hereafter. In this world arrogance appears pleasurable to a man because it satisfies his ego
distractors: This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Therefore, only those who can prove that they have the inclination to live their lives in this world without indulging in trivialities and deceit, will be chosen to inhabit the pure and sublime atmosphere of Paradise
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse primarily teach us?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: This shows in symbolic fashion that the emergence of the Hereafter from the present world is just as possible as the emergence of lush green foliage from dry barren land
distractors: This verse describes the creation of mankind
This verse is about the battles of early Muslims
This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only
